page.title: 20Wartime Relics
page.content: We saw 3 disused bomb shelters down church Lane. They were shaped like a 50 pence piece. Two were above ground and one was half buried and flooded with water. They each had four littl square windows where guns were poked through during world war two. In Church Lane there is a machine gun post and also inside the Radio Station. There are German machine bullets in one of the hangar doors. One of the remaining buildings on the airfield was the hospital. It still has a red cross beneath the window.
